Birmingham.Thomas Jefferson Hotel:
The Thomas Jefferson Tower is a 19-story building, completed in 1929 as the 350-room Thomas Jefferson Hotel, at 1623 2nd Avenue North on the western side of downtown Birmingham, Alabama. It is also known for a tower in its roof intended to be a zeppelin mooring mast.


== History ==
The Thomas Jefferson Hotel was planned and developed by the Union Realty Company, headed by Henry Cobb.
